packagegui.title: Reverse Proxy Server: General

field.description:
The interface(s) the reverse-proxy server will bind to (usually WAN). Use CTRL + click to select multiple interfaces.
Usage Instructions:
To use Squid as a reverse proxy ONLY:
After saving configuration here, you must tick the 'Enable Squid Proxy' checkbox under Services - Squid Proxy Server - General and click Save there.

To disable the reverse proxy ONLY (without disabling Squid completely):
Unselect all 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)', uncheck both 'Enable HTTP Reverse Proxy' and 'Enable HTTPS Reverse Proxy' below and click Save.

Squid will additionally bind to these user-defined IPs for reverse proxy operation. Separate entries by semi-colons (;)
Important: Any entry here must be a valid, locally configured IP address.
Useful for virtual IPs such as CARP, or for binding to IPv6 configured on an above-selected interface.
The external fully qualified domain name of the WAN IP address.

field.fielddescr: Reset TCP Connections on Unauthorized Requests
field.description: If checked, the reverse proxy will reset the TCP connection if the request is unauthorized.
If checked, the proxy server will act in HTTP reverse mode.
field.sethelp: Important: You must add a proper firewall rule with destination matching the 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)' address.

field.description: This is the port the HTTP reverse proxy will listen on. Default: 80
This is the HTTP reverse proxy default site. Leave empty to use 'External FQDN' value specified above.
If checked, the proxy server will act in HTTPS reverse mode.
field.sethelp: Important: You must add a proper firewall rule with destination matching the 'Reverse Proxy Interface(s)' address.

field.description: This is the port the HTTPS reverse proxy will listen on. Default: 443

This is the HTTPS reverse proxy default site.
Note: Leave empty to use 'External FQDN' value specified in 'Squid Reverse Proxy General Settings'.
Choose the SSL Server Certificate here.
Paste a signed certificate in X.509 PEM format here.
If checked, internal certificate validation will be ignored.
If checked, clients need a client certificate to authenticate.
Choose the CA used to issue client authentication certificates.

Choose the CRL used for client certificates revocation. If set to 'none', no CRL validation will be performed.
Important: This must match the 'Client Certificate CA' selected above!

After updating the CRL in System - Cert Manager - Certificate Revocation, remember to press the 'Refresh CRL' button below. Otherwise, the updated CRL will not have any effect on Squid reverse proxy users!

The compatibility mode determines which ciphersuite and TLS versions are supported.
Modern is for modern clients only (FF >27, Chrome >22, IE 11, etc.). If you need to support older clients, use the Intermediate setting.
The compatibility mode settings are based on Mozilla's documentation.
Warning: Clients like IE 6 and Java 6 are not supported anymore!
DH parameters are used for temporary/ephemeral DH key exchanges. They improve security by enabling the use of DHE ciphers.
Don't allow session reuse.
field.sethelp:
The current recommendation for web servers is to enable session resumption and benefit from the performance improvement, but to restart servers daily when possible. This ensure that sessions get purged and ticket keys get renewed on a regular basis.
Note: Disabling session resumption will increase the clients latency and the server load but can improve security for Perfect Forward Secrecy (DHE and ECDH).
